meanings.definition: A manner or appearance that reflects a person's character or mood.
meanings.sent1: She always puts on airs when she's around important people.
meanings.sent2: His airs were always cheerful and welcoming.
meanings.sent3: Her exaggerated airs at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The airs of confidence he displayed were truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious airs she carried with her captivated everyone's attention.

meanings.sent1: The musician played a beautiful airs on his flute.
meanings.sent2: The airs of the song were catchy and easy to remember.
meanings.sent3: The airs of the lullaby put the baby to sleep in no time.
meanings.sent4: The haunting airs of the music echoed through the hall.
meanings.sent5: The lively airs of the dance tune got everyone on their feet.

meanings.definition: To expose to the air; to ventilate.
meanings.sent1: She airs out the blankets every morning to keep them fresh.
meanings.sent2: Remember to airs the room after painting to get rid of the smell.
meanings.sent3: He airs his grievances with a touch of humor to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent4: The author airs out his thoughts in his latest book.
meanings.sent5: The fresh breeze airs the room, making it feel more inviting.
